item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the LH side.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL NO. 1 ROOF DRIP SIDE FINISH MOULDING CLIP

item.ptxt: It is only necessary to perform this procedure when replacing a No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clip with a new one.

If installing new No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clips, remove the adhesive remaining where the No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clips will be installed on the vehicle body and clean the vehicle body with a non-residue solvent.

atten4.ptxt: When installing a No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clip, heat the vehicle body and clip using a heat light.

entry.ptxt: No. 1 Roof Drip Side Finish Moulding Clip

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the vehicle body or clip excessively.

s2.ptxt: Apply a 2 to 3 mm (0.0787 to 0.118 in.) bead of adhesive (3M DP-105 or equivalent) to new No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clips.

atten4.ptxt: Adhesive strength (tensile strength): 13.7 MPa (140.0 kgf/cm2, 1991 psi) or more (when the temperature is 23°C (73°F))

s2.ptxt: Apply primer to the body where the No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clip will be installed.

atten3.ptxt: Do not let the primer dry.

s2.ptxt: While using the position shown in the illustration as a reference, place the No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clip onto the roof panel. Then position and install the clip after lightly pressing it so that the adhesive adheres to the primer.

atten3.ptxt: Install the rear roof drip side finish moulding when 40 minutes or more have elapsed after pressing and installing the No. 1 roof drip side finish moulding clips.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL ROOF DRIP SIDE FINISH MOULDING LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 2 clips to install the roof drip side finish moulding.
